description:
People Ops is always looking to make the experience of work better and more meaningful for Googlers. But innovating (and operating!) is increasingly complex when Googlers work in more than 50 countries, each with its own unique practices and regulations. The Diversity, Integrity & Governance team works to make sure we not only do what’s required by law, but that we continue to raise the bar and do what’s right for Googlers all over the globe. From supporting LGBT rights to extending parental leave benefits, we aspire to do the right thing in every part of the world: to be fair and inclusive, disciplined but not rigid, and consistent but not bureaucratic.

The Employee Engagement (EE) Products and Capabilities team is committed to building and strengthening diversity and inclusion acumen across Googlers, Managers and Leaders to nurture the EE mindset at Google.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience working in a capability building, organizational development, learning and development and/or human capital capacity.
  • 5 years of experience working in a fast-paced global environment driving culture change.
  • 5 years of direct people/team management experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Business, Human Resources, Organizational Development or a related field.
  • Experience in client-facing Diversity or Human Resources as a People Partner, Human Resources Business Partner, or Diversity Business Partner.
  • Experience in managing a global Diversity or Human Resources teams; demonstrated leadership, consultation and facilitation skills.
  • Understanding of Diversity and Inclusion; knowledgeable in building and delivering education content that helps solve for Diversity and Inclusion dynamics.
  • Ability to design and deliver education content to a variety of audiences.
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to translate metrics, research, and trends into strategy.
responsibilities:
• Provide effective people management through compassionate leadership, strategic guidance, domain expertise, career development and coaching to small team tasked with delivering human centric capabilities at scale.
  • Build and maintain an optimal team structure and supporting community that achieves key organizational goals.
  • Set bold vision and strategy that inspires the development of engagement products and solutions build through systems thinking that keep equity, integrity, risk management and accountability at the forefront.
  • Utilize a critical consciousness to create a globally applicable products and services roadmap driven by collective insights across Employee Engagement to accelerate representation, equity and engagement for Google. Demonstrate innovation and challenge the status quo of existing solutions through rapid prototyping and piloting of new employee engagement solutions.
  • Develop and operationalize the collection of insights to inform the creation and delivery of trainings, capabilities and new solutions to enhance the employee experience, while providing subject matter expertise through consulting and using evidence-based best practices to influence outcomes.
title: Products and Capabilities Global Lead
